fact_check_explanation_summary: The “Irish backstop” is an insurance policy in UK-EU Brexit negotiations to ensure there is no hard border in Ireland.

fact_check_explanation_title: Autism prevalence is up but scientists have consistently found that vaccines don’t cause it
fact_check_explanation_summary: More diagnoses of autism disorders are being made but they are not associated with being vaccinated.

fact_check_explanation_title: Islam in London: factchecking the viral image
fact_check_explanation_summary: This viral image makes claims about sharia law, mosques, no go areas and violence in London.

fact_check_explanation_title: Labour members did vote to debate Palestine over the NHS and Brexit at the 2018 party Conference
fact_check_explanation_summary: However, trade unions and affiliates voted for Brexit to be debated at the conference.

fact_check_explanation_title: Government uses bad measure of wage growth, again
fact_check_explanation_summary: Average wages for GB employees grew around 2% in the last year in real terms, which isn’t the fastest in a decade.

fact_check_explanation_title: Money for the NHS: is it new or not?
fact_check_explanation_summary: It all depends on what you mean by new. But the £1 billion was money that had already been promised to hospitals but which they were unable to spend previously.

fact_check_explanation_title: Flamingo egg yolks are not bright pink
fact_check_explanation_summary: Flamingo egg yolks are usually yellow to red in colour.
Abolitionist William Wilberforce was an independent MP, not a Tory MP, though he was fairly loyal to the Tory Prime Minister, Pitt the Younger.

fact_check_explanation_title: This viral image on immigration and homelessness has a fundamental flaw
fact_check_explanation_summary: An estimated 320,000 people are homeless in Great Britain, and that figure includes people who aren’t British.

fact_check_explanation_title: What’s a free port, and does the EU have them?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Free ports (areas within countries where import tariffs don’t apply) exist within the EU, but in a more limited form than elsewhere in the world.
Since 1900, it’s actually been the norm for Prime Ministers to enter office outside of a general election.

fact_check_explanation_title: This footage of the Queen doing the Nazi salute is real
fact_check_explanation_summary: The video was filmed around the time Hitler became Chancellor of Germany, before the Second World War began.
